title: How does the size affect fuel economy?
text:
Analysis
The displacement of an engine has a considerable effect on fuel economy. The data is from the Car Information Dataset found on Kaggle. Engine displacement is the amount of air the engine can combust. A 5.7L can hold and ignite that much air in the cylinders combined. Not suprisingly, higher displacement engines have a worse fuel economy because they burn more fuel. A higher displacement engine has 4x less fuel efficiency than a lower displacement engine.

title: About
text:
About the Project
This project was created for Kane’s Free Data Science Bootcamp, a 6-week course that teaches you the basics of data science visualization. I didn’t know how to make anything you see on this website before this course!
“This is data science”
~Preceptor

title: About
text:
About the Sources
I used a common car dataset from Kaggle for this data science project. https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/tawfikelmetwally/automobile-dataset?resource=download by Tawfik Elmetwally

title: Models
text:
stan_glm
 family:       gaussian [identity]
 formula:      mpg ~ cylinders + displacement
 observations: 398
 predictors:   3
------
             Median MAD_SD
(Intercept)  36.4    1.2  
cylinders    -0.5    0.4  
displacement -0.1    0.0  

Auxiliary parameter(s):
      Median MAD_SD
sigma 4.7    0.2   

------
* For help interpreting the printed output see ?print.stanreg
* For info on the priors used see ?prior_summary.stanreg
